lead_paragraph: ROTHSTEIN--Harold Jay, of Teaneck, NJ died on Wednesday, January 20, 2016, two weeks after being diagnosed with pancreatic cancer and one week before his 70th birthday. Carole Rothstein, his wife of 46 years had her head on his chest when he took his last breath. He was born on January 26, 1946 in the Bronx and was the youngest child of Rose and Milton Rothstein. He graduated from City College with a degree in sociology. He went on to complete his Master's in Education and "ABD" (all but his dissertation) for his PhD both from the New School. Starting out as a teacher in the late 1960s, Harold dedicated his life to education. He taught science until the mid- 1970s becoming an administrator in the 1980s and 1990s. Since retiring from the Board of Education he was an educational consultant mentoring students and teachers who wanted to become principals. He was proud of being involved in both Teach for America and the New York City Fellowship Program. Always the life of the party Harold lived every minute with passion. An avid photographer and world traveler he visited his 106th country in December. His life was filled with culture, music and art that he shared with his family and friends. Harold is survived by his wife of 46 years, Carole Rothstein, his sons Gabriel and Adam, his daughter and son-in-law Jessica and Randall Berman, his granddaughter Rachel Rose, his brother and sister-in-law Joel and Barbara Rothstein, and many nieces, nephews and cousins. In lieu of flowers, donations in memory of Harold J. Rothstein can be made to The Institute for Educational Advancement or the Lustgarten Foundation. Services will be 1pm today at Louis Suburban Chapel, 13-01 Broadway (Route 4 West), Fair Lawn, NJ. Burial will follow at Cedar Park Cemetery, Emerson, New Jersey. 1/3
